doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/2Q25 Beat Recent Rally Limits Further Upside DG to HOLD2Q25 Beat Recent Rally Limits Further Upside DG to HOLD_2025-08-31

passages.text: China (PRC) | Electronic Components LY iTECH

2Q25 rev beat with solid growth across segments, and EBIT/NP also better- than- expected. Overseas operations in India/US (24% of rev) used to be profit laggers, but we saw an encouraging sign of continued improvement, and India arm is about to breakeven with \(- 3\%\) net margin in 1H25. However, recent overwhelming rally has pushed its valuation to \(- 30x\) 2026E P/E, making it no longer attractive. D/G to HOLD until seeing better entry point.

2Q25 beat. LY's 2Q25 rev increased \(30\%\) YoY, beating JEFE/cons by \(15\% /7\%\) driven by 1) design wins for more components for both Apple/Android, 2) ongoing expansion to more auto customers, and 3) strong rebound of micro inverter business thanks to pricing hike. GM was flat YoY, in- line with JEFE/cons as a positive sign (rev growth not at the expense of margin). EBIT increased \(37\%\) YoY, beating JEFE/cons by \(14\% /11\%\) . NP grew \(61\%\) YoY, also beating JEFE/cons by \(21\% /22\%\) .

Encouraging sign from oversea plants' enhancing profitability amid rapid rev growth. LY currently has 58 production bases/R&D centers across China, India, US, Vietnam, Turkey, France, Brazil, etc. Specifically, India (mainly consumer electronics) and US (mainly micro inverter) ones under its subsidiary, Salcomp are the most important oversea facilities, with rev contribution surging from only LSD in 2021 to \(24\%\) in 1H25. Due to high costs and some pricing strategies in the past to penetrate deeper in key customers and secured more orders, both facilities were long in considerable loss ( \(\sim\) Rmb0.8bn net loss in 2024). However, with mgt's effort to strive to get better pricing and keep improving utilization rate, we have observed a continuous improvement in its NPM over past few years (Chart 1), and its India arm is about to turn profitable as an encouraging sign (net margin at \(- 3\%\) in 2025). We also believe LY's global layout of production bases could make it more resilient to supply chain uncertainties and enable it to seize more opportunities.

Future still bright, but recent re- rate overwhelming; D/G to HOLD. We raise our rev/NP forecasts in 2025E- 27E by \(1\% /40\%\) to factor in better- than- expected outlook, which are now \(9\% /8\%\) higher than cons (thoUgh we think buyside cons should be higher than sellside's). LY is currently trading at 42x/29x 2025E/26E P/E. While we keep positive on LY's growth opportunities in next few years, the street may be overly optimistic on it (Chart 2) especially in its data center/robot/upside potential amid recent bullish market trend. Therefore, we choose to stay on the side lines at this valuation level until mgt can further demonstrate its execution capabilities that match those new business opportunities. LY's stock price has surged by \(\sim 130\%\) since the trough in early- Apr with our bullish view playing out, which is now already fair in our view. We downgrade to Hold with a DCF- based PT of Rmb16.00 (10.0% WACC, 7.6% terminal growth rate), which implies 43x 2025E P/E and 1.5x PEG or 30x 2026E P/E and 1.6x PEG and, suggests only \(3\%\) potential upside.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 11- 17 of this report. \\* Jefferies Hong Kong Limited

- Rising penetration in Apple supply chain, including iPhone/iPad/MacBook/wearables- Higher penetration in Huawei/other Android camp supply chain and market share gain in smartphone- Future proliferation of Apple MR to become a long-term demand driver for structural parts- Increasing engagement in new energy business, including power battery/EV/microinverter.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- iPhone-related product shipments increase from 101m in 2024 to 97m/105m in 2027E/2030E.  
- Apple MR-related product shipments increase from 0m in 2024 to 1m/15m in 2027E/2030E.  
- Huawei smartphone-related product shipments increase from 20m in 2024 to 24m/25m in 2027E/2030E.  
- CATL battery-related product shipments increase from 43GWh in 2024 to 80GWh/115GWh in 2027E/2030E.  
- Enphase microinverter-related product shipments increase from 3m in 2024 to 7m/7m in 2027E/2030E.  
- PT of Rmb16.00 is based on end-2025 DCF with 10.0% WACC and 7.6% terminal growth rate (2030E).

- iPhone-related product shipments increase from 101m in 2024 to 119m/128m in 2027E/2030E.  
- Apple MR-related product shipments increase from 0m in 2024 to 2m/27m in 2027E/2030E.  
- Huawei smartphone-related product shipments increase from 20m in 2024 to 24m/25m in 2027E/2030E.  
- CATL battery-related product shipments increase from 43GWh in 2024 to 100GWh/138GWh in 2027E/2030E.  
- Enphase microinverter-related product shipments increase from 3m in 2024 to 11m/10m in 2027E/2030E.  
- PT of Rmb19.49 is based on end-2025 DCF with 10.0% WACC and 8.0% terminal growth rate (2030E).

- iPhone-related product shipments decrease from 101m in 2024 to 75m/82m in 2027E/2030E.  
- Apple MR-related product shipments increase from 0m in 2024 to 0m/6m in 2027E/2030E.  
- Huawei smartphone-related product shipments increase from 20m in 2024 to 21m/21m in 2027E/2030E.  
- CATL battery-related product shipments increase from 43GWh in 2024 to 47GWh/77GWh in 2027E/2030E.  
- Enphase microinverter-related product shipments increase from 3m in 2024 to 4m/4m in 2027E/2030E.  
- PT of Rmb9.70 is based on end-2025 DCF with 10.0% WACC and 6.0% terminal growth rate (2030E).
- High environmental standards imposed by key customers require strict energy management.- Attracting and retaining talent is critical to enhancing the company's competitive position.

- Zero incidence of environmental pollution penalty, fire disaster, serious injury, death, and occupational disease.- Subsidiary Salcomp (Guigang) committed to reducing carbon emissions by 25% from operation/energy-purchasing and by 12.3% from the value chain by 2030.- Strictly control the proportion of high-energy-consuming products within 5%.

- How to balance investment in clean technology and production efficiency with profitability?- What are the ST and LT plans for attracting and retaining talent? ESG report: https://static.cninfo.com.cn/finalpage/2023-04-29/1216690927.PDF

- Better/worse-than-expected iPhone shipments and share gain.- Continues/fails to remain as a key supplier for new Apple MR models.- Faster/slower-than-expected Huawei smartphone shipment rally.- Faster/slower-than-expected proliferation of power battery/EV/microinverter and LY's engagement.

Lingyi iTech (Guangdong) Co. engages in the research, development, and manufacture of ferrite magnets. It operates in five segments: materials precision functional parts, structural parts & modules, charger & specialty assembly, automobiles industry and others. The company was founded in July 1975 and is headquartered in Jiangmen, China.

Our price target of Rmb16.00 is based on end- 2025 DCF, with a WACC of \(10.0\%\) and \(7.6\%\) terminal growth (2030E). Key risks include: 1) faster/ slower- than- expected proliferation of Apple MR products; 2) market share gain from/loss to peers or new suppliers; 3) ASP/GM/hike deterioration due to strong/weak demand; and 4) faster/slower- than- expected growth in automotive/solar business.

Our 12- month forward PT is based on DCF to FY31E using a WACC of \(8.2\%\) and a terminal growth rate of \(2.5\%\) (implying 16.8x FY31E PE). Our PT implies 26.0x FY25E PE, 7.7x FY25E PB and 2.6x FY25E PEG. Key upside risks: 1) strong reception to Apple Intelligence in 2026, leading to stronger demand for iPhone 18, 2) stronger economic outlook for both the US and China, 3) step- up of gov subsidies in China that have no ASP limits, and 4) strong reception to a potential foldable iPhone in 2026. Downside risks are: 1) China/India tariffs rise further on retaliation and no compromise, 2) iPhone and other product sales suffer bigger decline due to price hikes to offset partly tariff costs and BOM costs, and 3) the company is forced to reduce its \(30\%\) share of app revenue and open up its iOS ecosystem for antitrust reasons.

Valuation: Our price target is based on a 50/50 blended average of DCF- and FY25 EV/EBITDA multiple- based valuation. Upside risks: (+) core upside tied to ratcheting up domestic contents requirement; (+) upcoming product launches prove more competitive than anticipated; (+) margins rebound despite tariffs, driven by higher margin new products (+) resi recovery despite 25D expiration.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
